    Backend Implementation for Task Management App

    I've completed the backend implementation for your task management application using Node.js and MongoDB. This backend provides all the necessary APIs and functionality to support the frontend we created earlier. Let me explain the key components of the backend implementation:

    Key Features Implemented:

    1. RESTful API Architecture

      • Complete set of CRUD operations for tasks, users, comments, and notifications
      • Well-structured routes with proper middleware for authentication and authorization
      • Error handling middleware for consistent error responses

    2. Authentication & Authorization

      • JWT-based authentication with secure token handling
      • Role-based access control (admin, editor, viewer)
      • Password hashing with bcrypt for security
      • OAuth integration for Google and GitHub login

    3. Database Models

      • Mongoose schemas with validation for all entities
      • Proper relationships between models (tasks, users, comments, notifications)
      • Indexing for optimized query performance

    4. Real-time Functionality

      • Socket.io integration for real-time updates
      • Live notifications for task assignments, comments, and mentions
      • Real-time collaboration features

    5. File Upload & Management

      • Secure file upload with Multer
      • Support for various file types (images, documents, etc.)
      • Organized file storage structure

    6. Reporting & Data Export

      • Comprehensive reporting APIs for task completion, team performance, etc.
      • Export functionality to PDF and CSV formats
      • Aggregation pipelines for data analysis

    7. Notification System

      • In-app notifications
      • Email notifications with Nodemailer
      • Scheduled reminders for upcoming deadlines

    8. Scheduled Jobs

      • Automated deadline reminders
      • Weekly digest emails
      • Task status updates

    Integration with Frontend:

    To connect the frontend with this backend:

    1. Environment Setup:

      • Create a .env file based on the .env.example template
      • Set your MongoDB connection string, JWT secret, and other configuration

    2. Running the Backend:

      npm install npm run dev

    3. API Configuration in Frontend:

      • Update the API base URL in your frontend to point to your backend server
      • Ensure the JWT token is properly passed in requests

    4. Socket.io Connection:

      • Connect to the WebSocket server from your frontend for real-time updates
      • Implement event listeners for notifications and updates

    Security Considerations:

    The backend implements several security best practices:

    1. Password hashing with bcrypt
    2. JWT for secure authentication
    3. CORS configuration to prevent unauthorized access
    4. Input validation to prevent injection attacks
    5. Role-based access control for authorization
    6. Secure file upload handling

    Deployment Recommendations:

    For deploying this full-stack application:

    1. Backend: Deploy to a Node.js-friendly platform like Vercel, Heroku, or AWS
    2. Database: Use MongoDB Atlas for a managed MongoDB solution
    3. Frontend: Deploy to Vercel or Netlify for optimal performance
    4. Environment Variables: Securely configure all environment variables in your hosting platform
    5. HTTPS: Ensure all communication uses HTTPS for security

    This complete implementation provides a solid foundation for your task management application with all the requested features. The modular architecture allows for easy extension and customization as your requirements evolve.
